name: sortition
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the practice of selecting officials where everybody has an equal chance of being selected: The most striking thing about Greek democracy was that the administration was organized on the basis of sortition. My preferred solution is to stop electing senators, and instead appoint them using sortition.
More examplesFewer examplesOfficers were elected by sortition, a kind of lottery whereby the offices were divided among the qualified.Appointing committee members by sortition would be more representative.The new system for choosing town leaders was based on a lottery system, also known as sortition.
